Description: Sets the name of the server that will appear in the server browser
Sets the website people can visit to gain more information about the server
Sets the address of the server discord that appears in the omp launcher
Sets the URL address for the server's light banner that appears in the omp launcher
Sets the URL address for the server's dark banner that appears in the omp launcher
Sets the URL address for server's logo that appears in the omp launcher and discord status
If set, the server will be announced to the open.mp masterlist
If set, the server's information will be displayed in the server browser
Sets the password required for players to join the server. Default is no password
Sets the maximum number of players (including bots) that may connect to the server at one time
If set, the server's RCON will be enabled
Sets the password required to connect to the server's RCON. Default is a strong random password
If set, RCON admins will be teleported to their waypoint when they set one
Sets an http address for a remote model server
If set, the server will use custom models from the directory specified under Custom Models Path
Sets the path where custom models are located

Sets the .dll or .so files in the 'plugins' directory that the server should use to run as plugins. Plugins are scripts which are designed to enhance gamemodes and filterscripts. Don't include the file extension
Sets the .amx files in the 'gamemodes' directory that the server should use to run as gamemodes. Don't include the file extension

Sets the .amx files in the 'filterscripts' directory that the server should use to run as filterscripts. Filterscripts are scripts that run in the background of a gamemode, adding extras without editing the gamemode. Don't include the file extension
Sets the .dll or .so files in the 'components' directory that the server should not load. Don't include the file extension

Sets how long the main open.mp and raknet networking thread will 'sleep' idly during each sync cycle. Higher values decrease server processing, but reduce sync quality, and vice versa. Don't change this unless your player count is very high and you have server FPS stability issues

If set, the server's tickrate will be kept at a constant count by using CPU more to cover the gap if there's any drop. The count is based on the Sleep Period (for example, Sleep Period of 5 = constant tick count of 200 ticks per second)
Sets the language that appears in the server browser. Players can use this to filter servers by language in the server browser
If set, the use of weapons in interiors will be allowed
If set, enables the Chat Radius

Set a radius limitation for the chat. Only players at a certain distance from the player will see their message in the chat. Also changes the distance at which a player can see other players on the map at the same distance
If set, the chat input filter will be enabled. Disable this setting to allow use of chars like % in the chat
Sets the global gravity that the server uses

If set, the server will try to find a player object slot already used by another player. Since per-player and global objects share an ID pool, if unique object IDs were assigned to each player, per-player objects could not be created once the maximum global objects were reached
Sets the lag compensation mode. 'Enable position-only' means player rotation won't be lag compensated for
Sets the mapname that appears in the server browser. This can be anything

Sets the gamemode that will be shown in the server browser. If the server has multiple gamemodes that require different gamemode texts, use the [SetGameModeText function](https://open.mp/docs/scripting/functions/SetGameModeText), which overrides this setting
If set, enables player markers (blips on the radar)
Sets the marker radius for all players
Sets the [player marker mode](https://open.mp/docs/scripting/resources/markermodes)
Sets the global time that the server uses and that will be shown in the server browser
If set, allows use of the animations missing from some versions
If set, enables all the interior entrances and exits in the game (the yellow arrows at doors)
If set, engines will not be automatically turned on/off when players enter/exit vehicles, and headlights will not automatically come on when it is dark
If set, enables the drawing of nametags, health bars and armor bars above players
If set, enables the Line-Of-Sight of nametags, health bars and armor bars above players
Sets the maximum distance to display the names of players
If set, the server uses standard player walking animation (animation of the CJ skin) instead of custom animations for every skin (such as skating for skater skins)
If set, enables stunt bonuses for all players, so that players will receive monetary rewards when performing a stunt in a vehicle (such as a wheelie)
If set, enables friendly fire for team vehicles. Players will be unable to damage teammates' vehicles
If set, turns on zone/area names, such as the 'Vinewood' or 'Doherty' text at the bottom-right of the screen, as players enter the area
If set, validates animations for players
Sets the vehicle respawn time
Sets the [global weather](https://dev.prineside.com/en/gtasa_weather_id/) that the server uses and that will be shown in the server browser. IDs above 22 can result in strange effects
Sets the maximum number of NPCs the server can hold. Affects how many of the player slots can be used by NPCs
If set, connection cookies requested by newly connecting players will be logged
If set, player deaths will be logged
If set, all queries sent to the server by players will be logged
If set, sqlite DB_* function errors will be logged
If set, all sqlite DB_Query calls, including the query string, will be logged
If set, allows players with the 0.3.7 client to join the server
Sets the time that the connection cookie seed value updates
Sets the grace period to allow unlimited connections from the same IP after starting the server,. Mainly used for NPCs
Sets the time that a client should update the server with new data while firing a weapon
Sets the time that a client should update the server with new data while in a vehicle
Sets the time that a client should update the server with new data while on foot
Sets the time that a client should update the server with new data while moving
Sets the rate at which a player's game time is updated
Sets the raknet ban time for bad connect packets, when the acks/messages limits are reached
Sets a network level setting to deal with DoS attacks
Sets the maximum number of messages a user can send per second
Sets the time the server will wait before accepting another incoming connection. Don't increase from zero unless the server is suffering a connection flood attack
Recommended to keep at the default
Sets the time after which a player will timeout when not sending any data to the server
Sets the public IP for the server, if different to the Application IP Binding. Only used for download servers

Sets the distance on the X,Y plane players will stream in server entities. Higher values makes players see server entities at a greater distance, but requires more client processing and potentially more bandwidth
Sets the time before the streaming in of server entities is retested for each player. Lower values increase server processing as it has to recheck streaming conditions more frequently for each player
If set, the server will operate in LAN mode
If set, enables open.mp encryption for network traffic
